name: Background on Tricky Dick Quiz / Test | U.S. Presidents | 10 Questions

questions.text: Nixon made a name for himself as an anti-communist by pursuing who?
questions.explanation:
Alger Hiss.

	It was Hiss ... who ultimately wrote a memoir entitled 'Laughing Last'.

questions.text: A key witness in the above case was:
questions.explanation:
Whittaker Chambers.

	His credibility was not beyond doubt.

questions.text: Nixon made his famous 'you won't have Dick Nixon to kick around any more' comment after he unsuccessfully ran for:
During Watergate, Nixon offered to have the tapes reviewed and 'screened' by:
The judge who presided over many of the Watergate issues was:
The chairman of the committee investigating Watergate was:
Nixon stated (when he left office) that this was his reason for doing so:
Ford succeeded to the presidency upon Nixon's resignation. Nixon, however, had really wanted his Vice President to be:
questions.explanation:
John Connally.

	He was advised that the public reaction would be negative and resistant, so he backed off and 'compromised' with the less controversial Ford.
